questions.question_text: A company's security policy requires full disk encryption on all clients with preboot enabled. The encryption server is hosted, and the requirement is to push an update to all endpoints. Which of the following is the BEST method to test and apply the update with minimal disruption to end users?

discussion.content: the answer is B because when they say "the server is hosted" typically refers to a web server. and B has the validate step which is essential

B. Access the web UI portal of the encryption server, apply the update to the test group,
validate, and then update all endpoints.
The answer is in fact B

choices.D: Access the web UI of the encryption server and disable preboot, apply the update, test, and then deploy the update to all endpoints.
choices.C: Add the update to the standard desktop configuration image, apply the update to a test VM, and then reimage clients.
choices.A: Access the API of the encryption server, develop a custom script, and then update all endpoints.
choices.B: Access the web UI portal of the encryption server, apply the update to the test group, validate, and then update all endpoints.

discussion.content: D is the correct answer because the question said based on the trend
I think answer is D. RAM is increasing trending

Why isn't the answer D) RAM? Given that there is an increasing trending of higher utilization, system may run into issues with running our of memory rather than disk which has been consistently high for many months.

questions.question_text: Before doing a change on a VM, a systems administrator wants to ensure there is an easy and fast way to rollback if needed. The change and testing should take approximately two hours. Which of the following is the EASIEST way to meet this requirement?

choices.C: Make an on-demand, full backup to a secondary location.
choices.A: Create a snapshot on the hypervisor.
choices.B: Make an on-demand, incremental backup to a VTL.
choices.D: Create a snapshot on a remote storage array.
